Complete Your First Project in R
Exploring Customer Data

```{r}
#run first
library(xlsx)
library(dplyr)
data1 <- read.xlsx("/Users/megansilvey/Documents/LinkedIn Learning/R Project Course/Red30 Tech Sales.xlsx",1)
data2 <- read.xlsx("/Users/megansilvey/Documents/LinkedIn Learning/R Project Course/Red30 Tech Customers.xlsx",1)
```

```{r}
#sort data by order total
data1[order(data1$Order.Total, decreasing = TRUE), ]
```


```{r}
#sort data by order quantity
data1[order(data1$Quantity, decreasing = TRUE), ]
```

```{r}
#get top products by total number of orders
data1 %>% count(ProdName, sort = TRUE)
```


```{r}
#get top product categories by total number of orders
data1 %>% count(ProdCategory, sort = TRUE)
```


```{r}
#review product category proportions
prop.table(table(data1$ProdCategory))
```

```{r}
#average sales and quantity by product category
data1 %>% group_by(ProdCategory)  %>%
                    summarise(mean_sales = mean(Order.Total), 
                              mean_quantity = mean(Quantity), 
                              .groups = 'drop')
```

```{r}
#total sales and quantity by product category
data1 %>% group_by(ProdCategory)  %>%
                    summarise(total_sales = sum(Order.Total), 
                              total_quantity = sum(Quantity), 
                              .groups = 'drop')
```

```{r}
#review product categories sold by sales regions
table(data1$ProdCategory, data1$Sales.Region)
```

```{r}
#review product categories sold by order type
table(data1$Employee.Job.Title, data1$OrderType)
```

```{r}
#review product categories sold by order type
table(data1$Employee.Job.Title, data1$CustomerType)
```
